page.title: 08ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: There are no public forms of entertainment. Pyrton and Lewknor both have village halls. Pyrton's used to be the old school and Lewknor's is actually part of the school. Jumble sales, Christmas bazaars,fetes, shrub sales, private parties and disco's, council and other meetings are all held in these halls. The school puts on two plays and concerts a year which the community are invited to. The 'Lewknor Singers'also put on concerts. Television is probably the most popular form of entertainment.(some have video's). We have a committee which looks after the playingfield. Cricket and football matches are played. CLUBS-Mothers and toddlers,keep-fit, monthly Friday club (general interest), ladies netball, self-help crafts, youth,and occasional bingo/whist drive.
